When we take all these factors into account, it's evident that the per-unit death toll of nuclear power far exceeds that of coal. While both technologies involve some risks, coal power is clearly the safer choice from a public health perspective. Of course, we should continue working to minimize the impacts of all energy sources, but the data shows that coal is currently the better option.
